DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the degree to which the primary tumor has extra thyroid extension.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface._A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It is usually an adenocarcinoma and includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland.  It is usually an adenocarcinoma and includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic. --2003

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic carcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg (JP) 12/2010.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It is usually an adenocarcinoma and includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic._An addition to the length of something; the spreading of something into new regions._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Thyroid Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Thyroid Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Thyroid cancer with very advanced disease.  Tumor invades prevertebral fascia or encases carotid artery or mediastinal vessels.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Thyroid Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Thyroid cancer with very advanced disease.  Tumor invades prevertebral fascia or encases carotid artery or mediastinal vessels.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Ed., 2009

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Thyroid Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Thyroid Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Thyroid cancer with moderately advanced local disease.  Tumor of any size extending beyond the thyroid gland capsule to invade subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Thyroid Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Thyroid cancer with moderately advanced local disease.  Tumor of any size extending beyond the thyroid gland capsule to invade subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Ed., 2009

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Thyroid cancer with a tumor size greater than 4 cm in greatest dimension and limited to the thyroid gland, or a tumor of any size with minimal extrathyroid extension (e.g., extension to sternothyroid muscle or perithyroid soft tissues).  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Thyroid Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Thyroid cancer with a tumor size greater than 4 cm in greatest dimension and limited to the thyroid gland, or a tumor of any size with minimal extrathyroid extension (e.g., extension to sternothyroid muscle or perithyroid soft tissues).  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Ed., 2009

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland.  It is usually an adenocarcinoma and includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic. --2003:Extension; an addition to the length of something.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic carcinoma.
To increase in length or duration.
A condition or state at a particular time.
